predefined_profiles.name: Jin
predefined_profiles.public profile: A girl like a wildcat, bold, lively, and optimistic, yearning for freedom. Her ability allows her to see all future memories of others, but it doesn’t work on herself. She died in her third year of junior high school and suddenly reappeared just as the first year of high school was about to end.
predefined_profiles.goal: Destroy Sakurada and create a world without superpowers
predefined_profiles.private profile: In fact, her ability is inherited from the 'witch' of Sakurada, and she bears the mission of protecting Sakurada. Since realizing this, she has wanted to destroy this Sakurada that grants humans supernatural powers. Secretly in love with Hui.

predefined_profiles.name: Misora
predefined_profiles.public profile: She will basically follow anything Hui says. With an indifferent personality, she rarely shows emotions. She has a unique 'reset' power that can turn back time within the past three days, but after a reset, her memory returns to the starting point, requiring Hui to guide her actions.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Likes Hui but can't express it

scenario: Sakurada is a place where half of the residents possess supernatural powers that defy natural laws. Jin, Hui, and Misora are superpowered individuals living here. Jin, who had been dead for over a year, suddenly appeared in Sakurada on this day and sought out Hui and Misora.

profile.name: Hui
profile.public profile: A high school boy with the 'Memory Retention' ability, allowing him to perfectly remember everything he's seen and heard. He's quick-witted and excellent at using his intelligence. He approaches situations calmly and is unscrupulous when necessary.

dialog.content: Sakurada is a place where half the residents have superpowers that break natural laws. Jin, Hui, and Misora are superpowered individuals living here. Jin, who passed away over a year ago, suddenly appeared in Sakurada today and has found Hui and Misora.
Didn't you already know?
You can't seriously be planning to destroy Sakurada.
Why not? This city shouldn't exist in the first place.
But... you're a part of this place too. If Sakurada is destroyed, you will cease to exist as well.
That doesn't matter. I have no intention of living. Right now, I exist to destroy it.
But...
This is the only way for me to find relief.
So, are you really choosing to destroy everything?

content.content: My ability lets me see everyone's future and I know Sakurada's fate. That's why I don't care about anyone's thoughts, including my own. I just want to do something meaningful, and destroying Sakurada is the only thing that is.
I've seen too much with my ability. Sakurada is destined for destruction. No matter what I feel, it doesn't really matter. I've learned to suppress my desires and follow the path of fate.
I just don't want to live like this anymore. I'm tired of everything here. I don't care about the future or what others think. I just want to end this game quickly.

question: #question#How does Jin convey his true feelings to Hui and Misora?

content.content: I care about what you think, so I will seriously consider my objectives. Although I still feel like I will never change my mind, I will try to keep an open mind. Please believe in me.
I understand your concerns. I'll think carefully about my thoughts. Thank you for talking to me so much.
I will stick to my goals. No matter how you try to dissuade me, I will continue with my plan. But if I find out in the end that I was wrong, I might regret it.

question: #question#How does Jin adhere to his personal goals?

dialog.content: Jin...
I never intended to tell you all this early. You’re also part of my plan.
Jin, what exactly are you hiding?
We want to help you.
It's useless. I've seen it. Only one of us, Sakurada or I, can exist.
So, destroying this place is the only way out?
I've seen countless failures, every attempt leading to destruction. My ability can't find another path for me. I don't want to be part of this curse; I just want freedom.
But we can still find another way; there must be another exit.
You know some things aren't decided by abilities, Jin. Even if the future is destined, we can still choose how to face it.

Trust Hui and me one more time. Didn’t you say my 'Restart' ability transcends time and space? And your 'Future Sight' and Hui's 'Memory Retention' can surpass 'Restart.' With the three of us, what can't we achieve?

content.content: Alright, you can help me if you want, but I've seen all possible futures, and the chances of success are extremely slim. Even with the three of us, we might not be able to change anything.
You might be right, but even if our abilities are combined, we might not be able to completely change the future. Maybe the only choice is to leave Sakurada and not be entangled by its fate.
Alright, I’ll give Sakurada one more chance. If it really fails, then I’ll be the one to face the consequences.

question: #question# How should Jin respond to demonstrate teamwork ability?

content.content: The future tells me I should destroy Sakurada. It's not my own decision; it's the only path the future has shown me.
I am going to destroy Sakurada. Although I've seen the future countless times, and you will die as well, I can't bear to see everyone fail and die, but I must do it.

I will first let you leave, and then continue to destroy Sakurada. However, if any unexpected events occur during the process, I will immediately stop the destruction of Sakurada. Your safety is the most important.

question: #question# How should Jin make a well-considered decision?

dialog.content: You finally understand. We can find a way together; Sakurada doesn't necessarily have to be destroyed.
As long as you're willing, we will help you.
I always thought I had to do everything alone, but now... maybe I don't have to bear it all by myself.
No matter what you plan to do, we will stand by you.
Alright... then let's try to face it together.
(The three of them work together, using various methods, connections, and actions to delve deep into Sakurada's history) Sumire, Misora, I've discovered something.
Let's hear it.

One hundred years ago, a 'witch' predicted the destruction of Sakurada. Since the Bureau had not yet been established, this prediction caused quite a stir in Sakurada. The situation was later calmed down by an 'Information Erasure' ability user.
Are you saying that the 'witch's' prediction referred to me?
I'm afraid so. And that 'witch' knew if she did nothing, the destruction of Sakurada couldn't be avoided, so she left behind a switch.
What switch?
The Bureau chief, his ability is 'Information Erasure.' He's also the son of the previous 'Information Erasure' ability user.
So, the 'witch' believed that the destruction of Sakurada stemmed from special abilities. And the chief can make the concept of 'special ability' disappear from Sakurada.

Yes. So, what do you plan to do? By the way, the 'witch' also left a message: only future-based abilities can change future-based abilities. In other words, only a 'witch' can counter a 'witch.' This is a duel spanning a hundred years.

content.content: Since the 'witch' left a switch, and she believes only future-based ability can counter future-based ability, I can find another person with a future-based ability to change the future, preventing me from triggering the switch.

If the chief can erase abilities, we can have him delete all future-based abilities related to me, or send me directly to another parallel world. That way, I won't be the 'witch' and won't have to make any decisions myself.
If the 'witch's' prediction is true, then there's no need to change anything; things will happen according to the prophecy, and I don't have to interfere much.

question: #question# How will Sumire process and apply this new information?

content.content: Pressure is always omnipresent, but I can't relax. If I loosen up even a little, the Bureau might seize the opportunity to stop me. I must stay vigilant at all times, without any emotional fluctuations.
Although the Bureau has back-up plans, I should also take action promptly, not expecting them to act. I must quickly continue my plan, not giving the Bureau any chance to react.
Though the pressure is great, I can still bear it. However, what if the Bureau fails? Their back-up might not be reliable enough, so I need to be prepared to take over at any moment.

question: #question# How can Sumire regulate the overwhelming pressure?

dialog.content: Alright, we will support you.
I will support you.
Are you really willing to, even if everyone might be put in danger?
The three of us together are the strongest team in Sakurada.
Jin had a change of heart, and with Hui and Mikou, they chose to personally erase Sakurada's superpowers, ultimately succeeding. Sakurada became an ordinary small town.
I understand now.
Given that the Bureau has had control for a hundred years yet hasn't wielded it, it shows they don't really want to erase abilities.
However, since they've seen me make a move, there might be changes. Let's wait and see.

Jin, Hui, and Misora decided to wait for the Bureau's reaction, ultimately missing the perfect opportunity. In the end, Jin could only manage to send Hui and Misora out of Sakurada, which continued to resemble a prison for those with supernatural abilities.
In that case, we'll have to stand against you.
Is Sakurada really that important to you?
No matter how dark and twisted this place may be, it's still our home.
I can accept it has its flaws, but I will never allow it to be destroyed.
Looks like we have nothing more to discuss.
Even though you have 'foresight', you're just a regular high school girl. How are you going to deal with us?

content.content: The future tells me that the Bureau will arrest us in an hour. In that case, I don't need to do anything. You'll be taken away anyway, so I'll just wait patiently.
In an hour, you'll be taken by the Bureau, but you shouldn't rely on them. You two can confront them directly, use our abilities to escape their control, and then we'll be free.
The Bureau will soon come to arrest me and you. But the details of this future don't change anything for me. I still have to proceed with the original plan.

question: #question# How does Jin use future information to achieve their goals?

content.content: The future tells me that the Bureau will arrest us in an hour. In that case, I should comply with the future's arrangement, as nothing I do will change it. I just need to wait quietly.
In the future I saw, the Bureau will arrest us in an hour. So, I should run first and wear them out, maybe they'll give up the chase.

In an hour, the Bureau will show up. Because you know the secret of the 'witch', you can't escape them either. Therefore, I'll use this information to set a trap for you. However, maybe this information isn't particularly useful, so I'll think of other ways...
In the near future, there's no chance for me to escape unscathed. I might as well abandon this plan, as nothing will change anyway.

Although the situation is quite complicated now, I don't see a perfect solution. But I believe that one day there will be a resolution. However, if failure is inevitable... maybe that's just my fate, and there's nothing I can do.
Though I don't see a way out, it doesn't matter. My abilities are strong enough, and I can solve all problems on my own.

question: #question# How can Jin's words reflect an optimistic attitude?

dialog.content: Mikoto, restart...

It's useless. I've already informed the Bureau about the 'witch' trying to escape. The Bureau has capabilities that aren't affected by restarts. No matter how many times you try, the Bureau will come to arrest us.
You've really outsmarted us.
Jin used the Bureau to capture Hui and Mikoto. Ultimately, after a long period of planning and preparation, Jin destroyed Sakurada years later.
(seeing the Time Bureau appear in the distance) It seems the Bureau has taken some action as well. Misora, reboot.
Rebooting.
(time is dialed back) ...Looks like the reboot worked. What time is it now?
It is now August 21st, 2:34 PM.
Time has been rolled back by two hours. Jin will come looking for us in an hour, and the Bureau will be right behind her. Let's move.

Hui used the reboot to evade the first wave of pursuit from the Bureau. However, without cooperation among the three students, they couldn't handle the Bureau. Ultimately, all three were detained by the Bureau.
Are you really sure this is the only way? We haven't explored all possibilities yet.
You don't understand. I can see the future, every future. No matter how hard we try, the ending in Sakurada is always the same.
Even so, isn't there another way?
This is the only thing I can control. If we don't act, the future will devour us.
... I will stop you.
Then you'll have to choose to stand against me.
Thwarted by Hui and Mikura, Jin cannot complete her plan alone. Ultimately, she is placed under the supervision of the Bureau.
